results.name: a(2n+1) = 2*n-1; a(2n)= 4^n.
comment: Conjecture: a(2n) is always a divisor of A132049(2n).
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,6,0,-9,0,4).
mathematica: Table[ If[ OddQ[n], n, 4^(n/2)], {n, 1, 31}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 02 2013 *)
CoefficientList[Series[(1 + 4 x - 3 x^2 - 8 x^3 - 4 x^4 + 4 x^5) / ((1 - x)^2 (1 + x)^2 (1 - 2 x) (1 + 2 x)), {x, 0, 35}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 20 2013 *)
